title: Ranked Has gotten out of control
body: The ranked system has gotten so out of hand.   In a gold game I get paired with a level 29 player......lvl 29 not even in placements yet...hmmmmm went from g4 to s3 in 2 days every game paired with multiple bronze player while the opposition has all s1 or s2 players Im about to quit this game sick of this shit.  was in gold almost all year and now all of a sudden Ive lost 18 out of my last 20 games because the opposition has a way higher elo then my team, this is not once in a while this is EVERY GAME.

You need to stop playing after 3 consecutive lost. Golden rule after losing a game, ask your self if your mad, upset, heated, angry, or feeling any type of negative energy. If yes than go do something to help you feel fresh before starting the next game. Play chmapions you know your good at and only stick with your best champs.

This has nothing to do with my play as the majority of the time my game score is higher then everyone on my team......the fact is a b3 adc will NEVER beat a s1 or g4 ADC in lane 2 games in a row bot lane gave up more then 25 kills its not my gameplay its the incredibly poor matchmaking system

https://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Zonetoxic002

Filter the game through solo Q only. 18 out of your past 20 games, you had over 5+ deaths. I look at this and i can tell you that your losing the game because your not playing very well which increases the chances of you losing that game and every game.

When i made my last comment i didnt look at your profile but my comment still stands. Only play your best roles/champs and only play when your feeling "fresh". You cant control what other players do but guess what? The good news is you have 100% control of your self as long as you dont let your emotion take over your actions. With that said, play to improve and work on your mistakes/weaknesses.
Thank you for your insight, just very hard not to die when a combined 10/0 bot lane roams up into mid at 10 min :)

I've come to the conclusion that the only reliable way to climb is to main ADC because bot lane is all that matters in this game. Whoever wins bot lane wins the game.

Jungler, mid, top lane don't matter. The lane with 2 players who get ahead and with the best scaling champs is the lane that wins.

As a jg I can camp top and get me a fed aatrox/fiora, it doesn't matter if my bot lane feeds their bot lane because their rakan CC's my top laner and he just blows up to a couple fed ADC autos and mage burst.

No lane matters more than bot, plus it gets you dragons which is miles above herald (and quicker to solo early game without getting contested).

I play high elo, and let me tell you, that isnt gonna change much. You could quit for the day, play next day, and get the same result. Soloqueue was a coinflip before, but now its a very obvious coinflip now that people who grinded positionals via duo abuse are back playing so they can make use of the worlds event (and fuck popular streamers climbing on their unranked to masters/grandmasters/challenger accounts).

I can tell you that its lot better than continuing on a losing streak. There are people that go from masters to d4 because they dont know how to stop playing the game when they are on a massive losing streak. They keep playing thinking they are gonna get back to masters or d1, d2, d3 and next thing they know they are in d4. Same thing with diamond players that goes on a losing streak and doesnt stop and end up getting back into platinum. This isnt something that just happens in high elo, it can happen to any ranks. 

Knowing when to stop when your on a consecutive losses will save you days and even weeks of gaming trying to get back to the elo you were before. If your still losing more than your winning than there is something that your doing wrong and need to reflect on what it is that you need to work on.

For me it's the ladder and riot's decision to improve the que time was nothing but a detriment to the game as a whole.

You cant create an artificial average of skill then use that to compare accounts for who is more skilled. It does not work like that, its a violation of the concepts used to build an Elo system and takes far more work for no real gain.

The ranked system can drive you crazy at times but its kinda fine. Let me explain it to you this way. You win and lose , sometimes the system gives you the better team and you win, its testing you if you are "that bad" and if you lose those kind of games - well thats bad. Sometimes the system is testing you on the other side, you are the one with the worst team, and the question is - "Can you carry this SH*T" - if you do - very good , if you dont - not that bad it was just a chance. I had many winning streaks, I felt like i cant lose a game and all that time I was thinking "I AM SO FUKIN GOOD DAMMMNNN" , but after that I got games where my team were like monkeys and this drived me insane. 
After trying to understand what was going on I kinda saw the picture. When I was winning I wasnt kinda carrying the team all the time, it was somebody else , I was helping, when I was losing hard I wasnt good enough to change the game. So in the eyes of the ranked system I am exactly where I should be and if I progress its going to be a slow and steady climb.

I saw your ranked history and can tell you that you are in the same spot even tho in different ranking (I am plat 1). Even it seems to me that you are losing your lane most of the times, no matter vs golds or silvers , winning/losing, you are behind. In the eyes of the system you are at your place. 

Also you play a lot. You want to climb and its not kinda working out so your mental drops which will reflect your gameplay which will reflect your mental and so on. Give it a break and watch some streamers that play your main champs, improve. I play mostly only on saturday evening and with 130 games I made it to high plat. I can even make it to diamond and higher but dont have the time for it. I learned from streamers and their vision of the game. 

Good luck.

I'm looking through your op.gg and the reason you are getting matched with B1 players  is because your MMR is low Silver. B1-S3 is what you are being matched with and against. Thats also why you got demoted from G4 to S1 and fell so quickly. It's actually incredibly difficult to get demoted between full tiers. It lets you stay in 4 divisions far too long. By the time you fell from Gold it was like a dam bursting. You MMR was already low Silver and once you lost the insane amount of protection you get in 4 divisons, you were just playing catchup at that point. Your rank means literally nothing to matchmaking. MMR does. Yes, you were being matched with low silver and B1 players, but you were also playing against them
